text: Adelite is a rare mineral. It is a calcium, magnesium, arsenate with chemical formula CaMgAsO4OH. Adelite was named from the Greek word for indistinct. It can be blueish-gray, green, gray, yellow, or light green in color. It is made of crystals. Adelite is not radioactive.Mineral Data Sheet It is scratched easily with apatite. The mineral was first described in 1891 in VÃ¤rmland, Sweden. It can be found in Flipistad, Sweden. ==References== Category:Arsenate minerals
title: Adelite
